issue.title: Suspicious state from syntax checker javascript-eslint

repository.name: flycheck
repository.description: On the fly syntax checking for GNU Emacs

issue.body:
Hello,
 
Flycheck version: 31snapshot (package: 20170911.127)
Emacs version:    25.3.1(I am using Spacemacs with React layer)
System:           x86_64-apple-darwin16.4.0
Window system:    ns

I am opening a js file, and the flycheck is not working properly.

Error message is:


```

Suspicious state from syntax checker javascript-eslint: Flycheck checker javascript-eslint returned non-zero exit code 1, but its output contained no errors: can't resolve reference #/definitions/basicConfig from id #
can't resolve reference #/definitions/basicConfigOrBoolean from id #
can't resolve reference #/definitions/basicConfigOrBoolean from id #
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><checkstyle version="4.3"><file name="/Users/grox/LintCode/LintCode/react/src/apps/problem/containers/ProblemListPage.js"><error line="19" column="26" severity="error" message="Multiple spaces found before 'style'. (no-multi-spaces)" source="eslint.rules.no-multi-spaces" /></file></checkstyle>

Try installing a more recent version of javascript-eslint, and please open a bug report if the issue persists in the latest release.  Thanks!


```
I used yarn global to install node packages(like eslint) and have upgraded them all.

issue.title: Fix: allow linting the empty string from stdin (fixes #9515)
